docs.lead_paragraph: BURR--Samuel Ethan. August 9th, 1986 to October 10th, 2014. Sam died peacefully in his sleep on the morning of October 10th. His solar presence illuminated all those with whom he crossed paths. He was the treasured son of Howard Burr and Marguerite Shore, cherished brother of Daisy Burr, nephew of Christine Burr Correa, Randall and Mary Burr, Robin and James Smith, Alison and Richard Dundy, James and Beryl Shore, cousin of Andrew Correa, Kenneth, Dana and Jennifer Loiselle, Josephine Defusco, and Jacob and Madeline Shore. Sam was a graceful, inquisitive and insightful writer, moving songwriter and singer, and lover of animals and beauty in all forms. Family and friends may visit the Swan Funeral Home, 80 E. Main St., Clinton on Wednesday, October 15 from 3-6pm. There will be a private burial at Indian River Cemetery, Friday, October 17th 10am, and a memorial service and reception at Trinity Church, Wall Street, New York, NY, Saturday, October 18th 10am. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to Clinton Animal Control, 860-669-1777. For online condolences, please visit: www.swanfh.com.

docs.lead_paragraph: As a young politician, Viktor Orban won plaudits for championing civil rights and free elections. Now as Hungary's prime minister, Western nations are alarmed at the way he is trying to consolidate power, including a government crackdown on rights groups.

docs.lead_paragraph: A 21-month-old girl is the first person in Michigan to die from the virus that has caused severe respiratory illness across the country, state health officials said Saturday.
